newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent ends 31 cents down on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent ends 31 cents down on profit-taking.

text.p: IPE Brent futures took a hammering in the closing hours ahead of a long weekend on extended profit-taking although gas oil's sober performance prevented a bigger slide, brokers said..
IPE October Brent last traded at $20.41 a barrel, down 31 cents and just one cent up on the day's low. It earlier failed to break through the high of $20.80 a barrel achieved in the morning session.
IPE gas oil closed unchanged at $191.00 a tonne for September, leaving the Sept/Oct backwardation intact at 75 cents.
"It's extended profit-taking and weakness in the crude," a floor broker said.
Traders said Brent was tracking NYMEX crude which had lost the support of heating oil futures a

In contrast to IPE gas oil, NYMEX heating oil fell 33 cents to $62.15 a gallon and brokers in London said a break through the $62 level would put further pressure on Brent when trading resumed in New York on Monday.
The London market will be closed on Monday.
"There is a lot of length in gas oil between $186 and up and if you see heat under pressure then you might see a bit of length liquidation and it might come under more pressure," the broker said.
